document.masterDocTitle: Rhabdias lamothei n. sp. (Nematoda: Rhabdiasidae) from Leptodeira maculata (Colubridae) in Mexico, including new records of R. fuscovenosa (Railliet, 1899) Goodey, 1924

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4. SEM microphotograps of Mexican
Rhabdias fuscovenosa
details of the external morphology. A. Anterior end, subapical view. B. Shape of the tail, sharp terminal point, subventral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Specimens deposited : Colecciỏn Nacional de Helmintos del Instituto de Biologίa, Universidad Nacional Autỏnoma de Mexico , CNHE 5385­5398 .

Remarks : The specimens examined in this study correspond with the range described for
Rhabdias fuscovenosa
(
Baker , 1978
;
Goodey, 1924
;
Jiménez­Ruiz, 1999
) (
Table 3
): they present six lateral lips grouped in two groups of three (
Baker , 1978
) (
Fig. 4
. A), the equatorial vulva (slightly pre­equatorial in some of our specimens), size of the body and the characteristic shape of the tail (
Fig. 4
. B).
